data.message: I hate it when FB puts stuff on my Home page and I can't delete it- Here are some games you might like or People you might know, and it just stays at the top of the posts no matter what I do.  That's MY page and I'm sick of FB self-serving ads.

replies.message: Hi Jan. You can adjust your ad preferences by clicking the 'x' or upside down arrow in the top-right corner of any ad. You can then manage your ad preferences and remove yourself from audiences who are shown that ad. Learn more at: http://on.fb.me/ZSi83v  -Elissa
Facebook is primarily a newer form of advertising.
Yea you can't complain when it's free dude #fail
Of course I can.  Why can't something be free and good?  If you accept c__p, you get c__p.  FB ads used to be less intrusive, but I guess making billions of dollars isn't enough for them.
Jan is right about the ads.  FB should be about keeping up with friends, family, + groups you belong to, + not to stupid ads about overactive bladders, etc.
Try Yuplar.com pretty much the opposite of FB & ad-free. Only thing is, it's invite only & hard to get into since its new.

I would agree, However if you click the little arrow drop down button thing it gives you an option to Hide all adds from facebook...same is true for most feed adds...so your argument is a matter of failure to look at all your options. >.<
Hmmm. I learn to thoroughly ignore advertising. Never even noticed this.
Lisalotte Hyde- I wish it were that simple, but I've been through everything and I don't have that option; why do you and I don't?

In fact, according to my settings only my friends should be able to post on my timeline, and I have never friended FB- so how can they post on my timeline?  Oh, they're special, they can ignore their own rules, apparently.
I would pay to have an ad free Facebook.
Funny, lol.  I'm not advocating ad free, I just don't want their ads in the middle of my time line- they can put as many as they want off to the side.  They have to pay all their employees some how.
